recipe_long_name: Theplas recipe - How to make Theplas
recipe_ing:
1 cup finely chopped fenugreek (methi) and soaked in salted waterfor 1/2 an hour
 2 cups whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 2 tsp besan (Bengal gram flour)
 1/2 tsp salt
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 1/2 tsp oil
 oil for preparing theplas
recipe:
Mix all the ingredients and make a soft dough
Divide into 10 equal portions
Roll them like chapaties
Heat tava and roast then by adding few drops of oil so they become dry
Remove and cover with cloth so that they remain hot and soft
Continue with others and when done garnish with some white butter or chuteny
tags:
Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
Breakfast Theplas, Parathas
Indian Tawa
Tava
Quick Rotis / Parathas
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 5 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Saur Cream Shrikhand recipe - How to make Saur Cream Shrikhand
recipe_ing:
2  lbs Sour Cream or hung curds (dahi)
 1/2 tsp saffron (kesar) strands
 sugar to taste  (also depands on sourness of Sour Cream)
 2  8 oz. cans of mixfruits, strained.
 1 1/2 cups mixed nuts
 1 tbsp milk (to soke kesar)
 4 tbsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
recipe:
Soke kesar in one table spoon warm milk for minute or two. 
Crush kesar in the milk with a spoon or finger.
Mix sugar and sauer cream in one bowl.
Mix teh kesar mixer with sauer cream and sugar. 
After two mints. add dry fruits and at the end, add 
Add regular fruits.  sprinkel elaychi on top and
Serve.
tags:

Traditional Indian Mithai
Diwali
Raksha - Bandhan

recipe_long_name: Basundi(pineapple) recipe - How to make Basundi(pineapple)
recipe_ing:
2 1/2 cups  (500 ml.) low fat milk
 3/4 cup  fresh pineapple, grated
 5 tsp sugar
 a few saffron (kesar) strands
 1/4 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 1/4 cup chopped pineapple
recipe:
In a small bowl, soak the saffron in a little warm milk and keep aside.
Put the milk in a broad non-stick pan and bring to a boil. simmer over a medium flame stirring continuously till the milk reduces to half original quantity (approx. 250 ml.).
Add the saffron mixture and cardamom powder and mix well. cool and refrigerate.
Combine the pineapple and sugar in a non-stick pan and cook for 5 to 6 minutes while stirring continuously till the sugar has dissolved. allow to cool completely.
Add the cooled pineapple mixture to the chilled thickened milk and mix well.
Serve chilled, garnished with the pineapple pieces.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Traditional Indian Mithai
Raksha - Bandhan
times: Preparation Time: 15 min, Cooking Time: 40 min, Total Time: 55 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Yellow Moong Dal Khandvi recipe - How to make Yellow Moong Dal Khandvi
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup soaked yellow moong dal (split yellow gram)
 1/2 cup curds (dahi)
 1 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 For The Tempering:
 2 tsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 For The Garnish:
 2 tbsp coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Drain and blend the moong dal in a mixer into a smooth paste, using a tbsp of water.
Combine the moong dal paste, curds, ginger-green chilli paste, turmeric powder, asafoetida and salt in a microwave safe bowl, mix well and microwave on high 7 minutes, stirring in between after every 2 minutes.
Spread the mixture thinly on the back of three 200 mm. (8") diameter thalis and allow to cool for five minutes.
Cut the khandvi into 50 mm. (2") thick strips and carefully roll up each strip.
For the tempering, heat the oil in a small pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the sesame seeds and asafoetida and pour on top of the prepared khandvis.
Serve, garnished with the coriander.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Jain Naashta
Evening Tea Snacks
Indian Birthday Party Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Besan Sheera recipe - How to make Besan Sheera
recipe_ing:
4 cups milk
 2 cups besan (bengal gram flour)
 5 to 6 tbsp ghee
 1/4 cup sugar
 2 tsp powdered cardamoms
recipe:
Method
Heat the ghee in a kadhai, add the besan and roast till the besan turns golden brown in colour.
Add the milk and mix well so that no lumps are formed.
Add the sugar and mix well and cook till the consistency is similar to a thick soup.
Add the cardamom powder, mix well and serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Jain Paryushan
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Masala Fada Khichdi recipe - How to make Masala Fada Khichdi
recipe_ing:
1 cup broken wheat (dalia)
 1/2 cup moong dal (split  green gram)
 1/2 cup green peas
 2 small potatoes , cubed
 2 small onions , cubed
 2 small tomatoes , cubed
 3 to 4 garlic (lehsun) cloves , crushed
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp ghee
 To Be Grounded Into Smooth Powder:
 2 cloves (laung / lavang)
 1 stick cinnamon (dalchini)
 4 to 5 whole dry kashmiri red chillies
 4 to 5 peppercorns (kalimirch)
 1/4 tsp dried mango powder (amchur)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
recipe:
Method
Clean and wash the broken wheat and moong dal with enough water.
Heat the ghee in a presure cooker, add the garlic and saute till the garlic turns golden brown in colour.
Add dry ground masala and saute for 1 minute.
Add the potatoes , onions, tomatoes , green peas ,broken wheat and moong dal, mix well and add the salt and 3 cups of water and mix well.
Pressure cook on high flame for 4-5 whistles.
Serve hot with curds or plain gujrati kadhi.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Gujarati One Dish Meal
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Rice and Moong Dal Khichadi recipe - How to make Rice and Moong Dal Khichadi
recipe_ing:
2 cups long grained rice (basmati)
 1/2 cup moong dal (split  green gram)
 3 to 4 tbsp ghee
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 5 to 6 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 to 3 chopped green chillies
 2 medium sized chopped onions
 1 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 1 medium sized chopped tomato
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp garam masala
 6 cups water
 salt to taste
 1/2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 For The Garnish:
 chopped coriander
 ghee
recipe:
Method
Soak the moong dal and rice for 15 minutes.
Heat the ghee in pressure cooker
Add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds and allow to splutter.
Add the asofoetida, curry leaves, green chillies and onions and saute till onions turn transluscent.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and all the masala, saute till the tomatoes are mashed.
When ghee starts leaving sides, add the soaked rice, moong dal, water,salt and coriander and stir it well.
Cover and pressure cook for 3 whistles.
Remove from the flame, allow the steam to escape and open the lid.
The consistency should be slightly liquidy.
Serve hot and garnish with coriander and ghee.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
collection of khichdi recipes
times: Preparation Time: 30 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 1 hours,

recipe_long_name: Narali Bhat-coconut Rice recipe - How to make Narali Bhat-coconut Rice
recipe_ing:
2 cups cooked rice
 2 cups grated jaggery (gur)
 5 to 6 cardamoms
 4 tbsp butter
 1 coconut , grated
 chopped mixed nuts for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Clean and wash the rice and soak in enough water for 30 minutes.
Combine the coconut and jaggery and add this to the rice and mix well.
Heat the ghee in a kadhai, add the rice and saute till the jaggery dissolves.
Add the nuts and mix well.
Add the cardamom powder and mix well.
Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Quick South Indian, Maharashtrian Rice Recipes
Quick Vegetarian Rice, khichdi Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Saffron Khichdi recipe - How to make Saffron Khichdi
recipe_ing:
250 gms rice (chawal)
 10 cardamom (elaichi) seeds, coarsely powdered
 180 gms ghee
 15 gms almond (badam) slivers
 15 gms black currants
 3  medium sized onions, thinly sliced
 120 gms toovar (arhar) dal
 4 saffron (kesar) strands
 310 ml coconut milk
 8 green chillies, sliced
 1/2  piece ginger (adrak), made into paste
 10 cloves (laung / lavang)
 4  small sticks cinnamon (dalchini)
recipe:
Heat ghee and sauté the almonds and currants till the almonds are medium brown remove from flame and keep aside, reserve ghee.
Sauté onions in the ghee, until crisp and brown, keep aside, reserve ghee.
In a saucepan, take 2/3 cup water and rice, half cook the rice.
Pressure cook the dal,  half cooked, add the dal to rice.
Add saffron, coconut milk, half the almonds and currants, fried onions, green chillies, ginger paste, cloves, cinnamon, salt as per taste and the reserved ghee, mixed thoroughly and cover.
Bring to the boil and simmer till rice and dal are cooked, stir the khichadi with a fork and leave on a very slow heat for 5 more minutes.
Serve sprinkled with remaining almonds and currants.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
One Dish Vegetarian Meals
One Meal Dinner
collection of khichdi recipes
Indian Pressure Cooker
times: Preparation Time: 20 min, Cooking Time: 45 min, Total Time: 1 hours 5 minutes,

recipe_long_name: Nutritious Hari Khichdi recipe - How to make Nutritious Hari Khichdi
recipe_ing:
2 cups chopped spinach (palak)
 1 tbsp oil
 1/4 tbsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/4 tbsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tbsp sliced ginger (adrak)
 1/4 tbsp sliced garlic (lehsun)
 salt to taste
 1 cup soaked rice (chawal)
recipe:
Method
Boil the spinach in enough water, drain and blend in a mixer to a smooth puree. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the ginger and garlic and saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the salt, turmeric powder and the spinach puree and saute for 5 minutes.
Add the rice and saute for 3 minutes.
Add enough water, mix well and cover and cook till the rice is cooked.
Serve hot.
tags: Gujarati Khichdi
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Quick Khichi recipe - How to make Quick Khichi
recipe_ing:
1 cup toovar (arhar) dal
 1 1/2 cups rice (chawal)
 mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 fenugreek (methi) seeds
 whole red chillies
 1 tbsp garam masala
 turmeric powder (haldi)
 salt to taste
 oil
 1/2 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 1 tbsp grated coconut
 raisins (kismis) and cashewnuts (kaju) (optional)
 2 cups water
recipe:
Wash the dal and rice in a cooker vessel. 
Add 2 cups water. 
Take a tsp of cooking oil. 
Add mustard seeds, methi seeds.
When the seeds splutter, toss one whole red chilli. 
Add this immediately to the dal-rice mixture.
Fry kaju in 1/2 tsp ghee till golden, add kismis and toss for 1/2 a minute.
Add this to the dal-rice mixture.
Add turmeric, salt, garam masala and dhania powder and pressure cook.
Before serving,sprinkle cocunut gratings and finely chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with ghee, papad and kadhi or dahi raita.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
Jain Snacks
times: Total Time: 0 mins , Preparation Time: TEN MINUTES   Cooking Time: 15 MINUTES

recipe_long_name: Methi Baked Muthia recipe - How to make Methi Baked Muthia
recipe_ing:
1 cup chopped fenugreek (methi) leaves
 1/3 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1/3 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1/2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1 tsp sugar
 1 tsp lemon juice
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp garam masala
 1 tsp oil
 salt to taste
 oil for greasing
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl, mix well and knead into a soft dough using a little water.
Divide the dough into 8 equal portions, shape into 8 equal  portions and roll them into small circles of 5" diameter.
Place them on a greased baking tray and bake in a pre-heated oven at 200°c (400°f) for 7 to 8 minutes.
Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans

recipe_long_name: Aloo Chapati recipe - How to make Aloo Chapati
recipe_ing:
1/4 cup plain flour (maida)
 3 potatoes boiled and mashed
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 3 chopped green chillies
 2 tbsp melted butter
 salt to taste
 ghee for cooking
recipe:
Method
\sieve the flour.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and knead it thoroughly to make a soft dough, water is not required.
Divide the dough into 4 portions.
Roll out each portion of the dough into a thin round chapatis with the help of a little flour.
Cook on a hot tawa (griddle) on both sides using a little ghee until pink spots come on both the sides.
Serve hot.
tags: Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sooji & Veg Dhokla recipe - How to make Sooji & Veg Dhokla
recipe_ing:
1 1/4 cups semolina (rava)
 2 cups buttermilk
 1/4 cup  boiled chopped mixed vegetables
 2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1 1/2 tsp  eno's fruit salt
 1 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 oil for greasing
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1 tbsp oil
recipe:
Mix the semolina, buttermilk, vegetables, ginger-green chilli
Paste, oil and salt in a bowl to make a smooth batter. keep aside for at
Least 30 minutes.
Add the fruit salt, mix well and pour the batter into a greased 200
Mm. (8") diameter thali. steam for 8 to 10 minutes.
Prepare the tempering by heating the oil, adding the mustard seeds,
Sesame seeds and asafoetida and frying until the seeds crackle. pour
The tempering over the prepared dhokla.
Cut into pieces and serve hot with green chutney.
tags:

Breakfast Dhokla

recipe_long_name: Sabudana Wada  By singhr recipe - How to make Sabudana Wada  By singhr
recipe_ing:
200 gms sago (sabudana) (soaked for 1/2 hour)
 100 gms powdered peanuts
 2 onions, finely chopped
 1/2  bunch coriander (dhania), finely chopped
 oil to fry
 1/2 tbsp lemon juice
 5 green chillies, chopped
 salt to taste
recipe:
Put the soaked sabudana in teh vessel
Add the powdered groudnuts with sabudhana
Add fineny chopped onions,coriender leaves,chillies,salt,lemon juice and make the mixture with out adding a drop of water.
Now make the shape of wadas with the mixture and deep fry in the oil

recipe_long_name: Masala Bhat  By Tiwari_anuja recipe - How to make Masala Bhat  By Tiwari_anuja
recipe_ing:
1 1/2 cups long grained rice (basmati)
 8 small brinjal (baingan / eggplant)
 4 tbsp oil
 8 to 10 tendli
 1/4 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 6 to 7 whole dry kashmiri red chillies
 1/2 cup dessicated coconut  (kopra)
 2 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 10 cashewnuts (kaju)
 1/4 cup freshly grated coconut
 2 bayleaf (tejpatta)
 5 to 6 cloves (laung / lavang)
 3 to 4 cardamoms
 1 black cardamom (badi elaichi)
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp lemon juice
recipe:
Method
Soak rice in 3 cups of water for 30 minutes. Drain and keep aside.
Wash brinjals and slit 4 brinjals crosswise leaving the stem intact.
Remove the stems and cut the remaining into cubes and soak them in salted water.
Wash and cut the tendlis into 4 lengthwise.
Dry roast coriander seeds, cumin seeds, whole red chillies, dry coconut till a nice aroma comes.
Cool and blend in a mixer into a smooth paste, using little water. Keep aside.
Roast cashewnuts and keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan and add the bay leaves, cloves, green cardamoms, black cardamoms and sauté for a minute.
Add the masala paste and sauté for 3 minutes.
Add the tendlis and brinjals, mix well and add the salt, turmeric powder and mix well and cook for five to eight minutes.
Add the rice and 3 cups of water and mix well.
Add roasted cashewnuts, half the coriander, mix well and cook for five to seven minutes. The rice is cooked.
Garnish with coconut and remaining coriander.
Add the lemon juice and serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 15  mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Masala Bhaat - Sk recipe - How to make Masala Bhaat - Sk
recipe_ing:
1 1/2 cups long grained rice (basmati)
 8  small brinjals (baingan / eggplant)
 salt to taste
 8 to 10 tendlis
 Fresh Coriander Leaves 1/4  medium sized
 6 to 7  whole red chillies
 1/2 cup  grated dry coconut (kopra)
 2 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 10 cashewnuts (kaju)
 1/4 cup grated coconut
 4 tbsp oil
 2 bayleaves (tejpatta)
 5 to 6 cloves (laung / lavang)
 3 to 4 cardamoms (elaichi)
 1 black cardamom (badi elaichi)
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tbsp lemon juice
recipe:
Soak rice in three cups of water for half an hour.
Wash brinjals and slit four brinjals crosswise leaving the stem intact. remove stem and cut the remaining into cubes. soak them in salted water.
Wash and cut tendlis into four lengthwise. clean, wash and chop fresh coriander leaves. remove stems of whole red chillies.
Dry roast coriander seeds, cumin seeds, whole red chillies, dry coconut till a nice aroma is given out. cool and grind into a paste with a little water.
Roast cashewnuts and keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan. add bay leaves, cloves, green cardamoms, black cardamoms and sauté for a minute. add masala paste and sauté. add tendlis and brinjals and mix. add salt, turmeric powder and stir. cook for five to eight minutes.
Drain water from soaked rice and add to the pan. add three cups of water and mix. add roasted cashewnuts, half the coriander leaves and adjust salt. cook for five to seven minutes. cover with lid and cook on medium heat till done.
Garnish with scraped coconut and remaining coriander leaves. if you wish you can also sprinkle some lemon juice and serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 10 min, Cooking Time: 30 min, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Masala Bhat  By shshy recipe - How to make Masala Bhat  By shshy
recipe_ing:
2  boiled potatoes
 1/4 onion , cut into slits
 1  medium tomato , chopped
 1 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 2 tsp olive oil
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing) and turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp garam masala
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1  small green chilli , chopped  into small pieces
 1  small strand of curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) leaves
 1 tsp ghee
 1 1/2  glass of rice (chawal)
recipe:
Microwave the rice or pressure cooker it. 
Meanwhile, mash the potatoes into slightly medium chunks.
In a kadai, heat olive oil.
Add jeera. after it becomes hot, add the cut curry leaves. 
Add ginger-garlic paste. add onions.
Add hing, haldi, chili powder & garam masala. 
After a minute, add the cut tomatoes & green chilies.
Add salt & mix well. now add the boiled mashed potatoes.
Stir for 2 minutes. switch off the gas.
After the rice is done, add it to the kadai. mix well. 
Add a 1 tsp of ghee & coriander leaves.
Keep it closed.
Mix & serve while ready to eat.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 4 min, Total Time: 4 mins ,     Cooking Time: 20 min (including rice cooking)

recipe_long_name: Khakhra- Papad Nu Chewdo recipe - How to make Khakhra- Papad Nu Chewdo
recipe_ing:
10 left over chapatis
 6 papad , roasted
 chilli powder to taste
 salt to taste
 powdered sugar
 ghee for cooking
recipe:
Method
Heat a tava and roast the left over chapatis, using little ghee into crisp golden brown khakhras. Keep aside.
Crumble the khakhras and papad into tiny pieces using hands and keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a pan, add the coarse powder, salt, red chilli powder and sugar, mix well and saute for 5 to 7 minutes.
Remove from the flame and keep aside to cool.
Store in an air-tight container.
tags: Gujarati  Dry Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 5  mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Moong Dal Khandvi  By Foodie #48100 recipe - How to make Moong Dal Khandvi  By Foodie #48100
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup soaked moong dal (split  green gram)
 1/2 cup curds (dahi)
 1 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Drain and blend the moong dal in a mixer to a smooth paste using 1 tbsp of water.
Combine the moong dal paste, curds, ginger-green chilli paste, turmeric powder, asafoetida and salt and mix well in a microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 7 minutes, stirring in between after every 2 minutes.
Spread the mixture thinly on the back of three 200 mm. (8") diameter thalis while its hot.
Cool and cut the khandvi into 50 mm. (2") thick strips and carefully roll up each strip.
For the tempering
Heat the oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds.
When they crackle, add the sesame seeds and asafoetida and pour on top of the prepared khandvis.
Serve, garnished with the coriander.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Indian Steamed Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Microwave Khandvii recipe - How to make Microwave Khandvii
recipe_ing:
1 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 3 cups buttermilk
 salt to taste
 a pinch of turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tbsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 2 to 3 green chillies , thinly sliced
 grated coconut for garnishing
 finely chopped coriander (dhania) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Combine the besan, buttermilk, salt and turmaric powder in a microwave safe bowl and whisk well so that no lumps remain.
Microwave on high for 5 minutes.
Remove, mix well and microwave on high for 3 more minutes.
Again, remove, mix well and microwave again on high 2 more minutes.
Spread the cooked batter over a aluminium foil or back of a greased thali to a very thin circle, while its still hot.
Cool and cut into strips of 3" wide and 9-10" long and roll them neatly.
Heat the oil in small pan and add the musturd seeds.
When seeds crackle, add the sesame seeds and green chillies and saute for 10 seconds.
Spread them over the khandvi and garnish with coconut and coriander.
Serve.
tags: Gujarati Farsans
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Butter Milk Khichdi recipe - How to make Butter Milk Khichdi
recipe_ing:
1 1/2 cups rice (chawal)
 5 cups buttermilk
 2 tbsp ghee
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tbsp chopped mixed nuts
 2 tsp urad dal (split black lentils)
 6 to 8 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 whole dry kashmiri red chillies
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Heat the ghee in a deep pan, add the dals and nuts and saute till they turn golden brown.
Add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the red chillies, curry leaves and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the buttermilk and bring to boil.
Add the salt and rice, mix well and cover and cook on a slow flame till the rice is cooked.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.
tags: Gujarati Khichdi
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Mohanthaal  By B_kajaria recipe - How to make Mohanthaal  By B_kajaria
recipe_ing:
1 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 50 gms mava (khoya)
 1/2 cup ghee
 2/3 cup sugar
 1/4 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 a few saffron (kesar) strands
 1/8 tsp nutmeg (jaiphal) powder
 few almond (badam) slivers for garnishing
 2 tbsp milk
recipe:
Method
Heat the ghee in a pan.
Take besan in a thali, make a depression at the centre and pour 1 tbsp of hot ghee, add 1 tbsp of milk on top of hot ghee
Repeat the process once again by pouring 1 or 2 tbsp of hot ghee more, mix well.
Saute the flour on low flame till light brown with the remaining ghee.
Add the mava and saute again till reddish brown. Keep aside.
Add 1/3 cup water to the sugar, mix well and boil to prepare syrup of 1 ½ string consistency.
Pour the syrup over the flour, add all the masalas and mix well and keep aside, till it thickens on its own.
Pour in a greased thali and spread well.
Sprinkle slices of almond and pistachio.
When cool cut into pieces.
tags: Gujarati Sweet Mithai
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Vaangi Bhaat  By gunju recipe - How to make Vaangi Bhaat  By gunju
recipe_ing:
2 cups rice (chawal)
 10 tbsp groundnut oil
 1  lemon sized ball tamarind (imli)
 2 onions
 10 to 12  baby brinjals (baingan / eggplant)
 4 green chillies
 1 tbsp chana dal (split Bengal gram)
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 6 whole red chillies
 1  spring of curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp black peppercorns (kalimirch)
 4 red chillies
 1/2 tsp fennel seeds (saunf)
 1 tbsp poppy seeds (khus-khus)
 2 cloves (laung / lavang)
 2 cardamoms (elaichi)
recipe:
Wash and boil rice in plenty of water till three fourths done. drain well, mix four tablespoons of oil and cool. 
Soak the tamarind in warm water and extract the pulp and keep aside. 
Heat two tablespoons of oil and lightly fry the masala ingredients. cool and grind to a coarse powder. 
Peel and slice onions, wash and cut brinjals into four or six pieces. wash and slit the green chillies. 
Soak chana dal for about ten minutes, drain and keep aside. 
Heat the remaining oil and temper with mustard seeds, red chillies, curry leaves and the chana dal. fry till well roasted and light brown in color. add the onion and sauté till it turns pink. add the green chillies and stir. 
Add the brinjals and stir-fry on high heat till it is half done. sprinkle turmeric powder, asafoetida and salt and add the tamarind pulp. 
Add the masala powder and cook till the brinjal is completely cooked. 
Mix the rice into this thoroughly and toss over high heat. 
Reduce heat, sprinkle little water, cover and cook till the rice is soft and completely cooked.
